here are some scientific outreach initiatives I have participated in and led Panel member in UVic Water Research and the SDGs: A Panel Discussion (2022). Watch the panel discussion here. Participating scientist in the inaugural Water Day on the Hill (2020). An event that brought together water scientists across Canada to meet with parliamentarians and senior federal officials to raise awareness around water security in Canada. Read the report about the day of activities here.

curriculum development I have co-developed a set of resources to support teaching sustainability, equity, and anti-racism in undergraduate civil engineering curriculum. These resources are available on the “Learn and Teach Green, People-Centered Civil Engeering website. teaching assistant roles I have lectured, taught labs, and performed other teaching assistant roles in the following courses: CIVE 445: Groundwater Hydrology CIVE 440: Hydrology and Hydraulics CIVE 345: Fluid Mechanics CIVE 340: Sustainable Water Resources My mean teaching assistant effectiveness score from end-of-term student surveys is 9.
